bibl.title: Karanis Revealed: Artifacts from the Exhibition.
Karanis Revealed. Discovering the Past and Present of a Michigan Excavation in Egypt

bibl.note: Checklist of artifacts from the exhibition ""Karanis Revealed"" (Kelsey Museum, 2011-2012) [Nos 1-138]. - A Priest from Karanis. - Karanis: Early History. - Religion at Karanis: Egyptian and Hellenistic Traditions. - Found in Context. - Fragments. - Occupations and Activities at Karanis. - Money, Taxes, Agriculture, and Paperwork. - Lost, Discarded and Hidden. - Home Security. - Karanis Stratigraphy. - Finding Magic at Karanis. - Toys in Context. - Side Project: Dimé (Ancient Soknopaiou Nesos). - Side Project: Terenouthis. - Late Karanis. - Christianity at Karanis. - Mysterious Bones. - The Roman Military at Karanis. - Pottery, Everywhere. - A Karanis Burial.
bibl.seg: Terry G. Wilfong & Andrew W.S. Ferrara, Karanis Revealed: Artifacts from the Exhibition.

Terry G. Wilfong (ed.), with the assistance of Andrew W.S. Ferrara, Karanis Revealed. Discovering the Past and Present of a Michigan Excavation in Egypt = Kelsey Museum Publication 7 (Ann Arbor, 2014) pp. 47-120, figg. 22-40
